member.name: T:vxlapi_NET20.XLDriver
member.summary: Vector XL Driver Library Wrapper for C# Have a closer look to XL Driver API Decription for detailed information.

members.member:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Reads application configuration. See XL API Description for further details.
Application name in Vector Hardware Config. Channel of application. Reference where to store. Reference where to store. Reference where to store. Reference where to store. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets application configuration. See XL API Description for further details.
Application name in Vector Hardware Config. Channel of application. The hardware type to store. The hardware index of same hw types. The channel index of the selected hardware. Bus type which should be set. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Opens the port. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This han-dle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Name which is displayed in Vector Hardware Config for a given hardware. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Reference to a variable where the mask is returned for the channel for which init access is granted. As the input there must be the chan-nel mask where is the init access requested. A LIN channel needs init access. Size of the port receive queue allocated by the driver. Specifies how many events can be stored in the queue. The value should be a power of 2 and within a range of 16…32786. The actual queue size is rxQueueSize-1. Bus type that should be activated. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Opens the port. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This han-dle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Name which is displayed in Vector Hardware Config for a given hardware. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Reference to a variable where the mask is returned for the channel for which init access is granted. As the input there must be the chan-nel mask where is the init access requested. A LIN channel needs init access. Size of the port receive queue allocated by the driver. Specifies how many events can be stored in the queue. The value should be a power of 2 and within a range of 16…32786. The actual queue size is rxQueueSize-1. Current API version, e.g. XL_INTERFACE_VERSION (see XLCLass.XLmessageFlags). Bus type that should be activated. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
XL_SetTimerRate. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This han-dle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Value specifying the interval for cyclic timer events generated by a port. If 0 is passed, no cyclic timer events will be generated. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
XL_SetTimerRate. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This han-dle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. A mask specifying the channels, at which the timer events may be generated. Please note that the driver selects the best suitable (accurate) channel of the entire channel mask for timer event generation. This selected channel is returned in timerChannelMask. Value specifying the interval for cyclic timer events generated by a port. If 0 is passed, no cyclic timer events will be generated. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Resets Clock (time stamps). See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This han-dle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Creates event WIN32 handle for Rx events. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This han-dle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Buffer for WIN32 event handle. Queue level that triggers this event. For LIN it is fixed to 1. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Flushesreceive queue. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This han-dle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Returns the number of events in the receive queue. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This han-dle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Buffer where the actual count of events in the receive queue is returned. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Activates the channel. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Bus type that should be activated, e.g. XL_BUS_TYPE_CAN (see XLClass.XLbusTypes). Additional flags for activating the channels. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Reads events from hardware queue if available. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Empty XL event buffer. The received XL event will be available in the buffer. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Reads events from hardware queue if available. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Number of events to be read at once from the queue. Empty list which will be loaded at once with the number of requestet events (if available). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Returns the sync time. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Points to variable, where the sync time is received. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Generates sync pulse. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Dectivates the channel. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Closes the port of prepared port. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This function returns an array (type of XLClass.xl_license_info) with all available licenses from the selected Vector device. See XL API Description for further details.
The channel mask of the Vector device containing the licenses. Array of XLClass.xl_license_info which receives the license info. Size of the array. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets channel to silent (no ack) or normal. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Specifies the output mode of the CAN chip, e.g. XL_OUTPUT_MODE_NORMAL or XL_OUTPUT_MODE_SILENT (see XLClass.XLoutputModes). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Turns on/ off XL_CAN_MSG_FLAG_TX_COMPLETED and XL_CAN_MSG_FLAG_TX_REQUEST flags. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. A flag specifying whether the channel should generate receipts when a message is transmitted by the CAN chip. A flag specifying whether the channel should generate receipts when a message is ready for transmission by the CAN chip. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Suppresses error frames and chipstate events with 1 and allows them with 0. Default is to allow error frames and chipstate events.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Suppress error frames if set to 1. Suppress chipstate events if set to 1. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets transceiver modes. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. E.g. XL_TRANSCEIVER_TYPE_CAN_1041_opto (see XLClass.XLtransceiverTypes). E.g. XL_TRANSCEIVER_LINEMODE_SWC_WAKEUP (see XLClass.XLtransceiverModes). E.g. XL_TRANSCEIVER_RESNET_NA (see XLClass.XLtransceiverModes). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Inits channel params with a set of prepared chip params. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Chip parameters to be set. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- /// Offers C200 Basic-CAN controller settings. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. BTRO value for a C200 or 527 compatible controllers. BTR1 value for a C200 or 527 compatible controllers. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets the bitrate of current port. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Bit rate in BPS. May be in the range 15000-1000000. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets acceptance filter. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. The acceptance code for id filtering. The acceptance mask for id filtering, bit = 1 means relevant. To distinguish whether the filter is for standard or extended identifiers XL_CAN_STD or XL_CAN_EXT (see XLCLass.XLacceptanceFilter). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets acceptance filter. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. The acceptance code for id filtering. The acceptance mask for id filtering, bit = 1 means relevant. To distinguish whether the filter is for standard or extended identifiers XL_CAN_STD or XL_CAN_EXT (see XLCLass.XLacceptanceFilter). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Adds acceptance region for standard IDs. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. First ID to pass acceptance filter. Last ID to pass acceptance filter. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Remove acceptance region for standard IDs. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. First ID to remove. Last ID to remove. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Resets acceptance region. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. In order to distinguish whether the filter is reset for standard or extended identifiers XL_CAN_STD or XL_CAN_EXT (see XLClass.XLacceptanceFilter). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Requests a CAN controller chip state for all selected channels. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Transmits a complete collection of xl CAN events.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. A collection of one ore more XL events to be transmitted. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Transmits a single CAN event.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. A single XL event to be transmitted. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Flushes CAN transmit queue. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Reads/sets the software synchronization setting in the Vector Hardware Config tool. This setting is written to the registry and read every time when the driver is loaded. To reload the driver of a connected interface, unconnected and reconnected it.
(uint)XLClass.XLgloblalSync.XL_SET_TIMESYNC_NO_CHANGE or (uint)XLClass.XLgloblalSync.XL_SET_TIMESYNC_ON or (uint)XLClass.XLgloblalSync.XL_SET_TIMESYNC_OFF Buffer which stores the previous value.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Defines the mode of the LIN channel and the baudrate. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Parameter settings like baudrate and LIN version. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Defines the DLC length for all requested LIN messages. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Specifies the length of all LIN messages (0…63). The value can be 0…8 for a valid DLC. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This function is only for a LIN 2.0 node and must be called before activating a channel. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. XL_LIN_CHECKSUM_CLASSIC, XL_LIN_CHECKSUM_ENHANCED or XL_LIN_CHECKSUM_UNDEFINED (see XLClass.XLlinParams). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets up a LIN slave. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. LIN ID on which the slave transmits a response. Contains the data bytes. Defines the dlc for the LIN message. Defines the checksum (it is also possible to set a faulty checksum). If the API should calculate the checksum use the following defines: XL_LIN_CALC_CHECKSUM or XL_LIN_CALC_CHECKSUM_ENHANCED. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sends a master LIN request to the slave(s). See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Contains the master request LIN ID. For future use. At the moment set to 0. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sends a wake-up. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Activate the sleep mode. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. XL_LIN_SET_SILENT or XL_LIN_SET_WAKEUPID (see XLClass.XLlinParams). Defines the linID that is transmited at wake-up. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The function can switch on/off a LIN slave during measurement.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Contains the master request LIN ID. XL_LIN_SLAVE_ON or XL_LIN_SLAVE_OFF (see XLClass.XLlinParams). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Configures the analog lines. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Mask for lines to be configured as input. Generally the inverted value of the output mask can be used. Mask for lines to be configured as output. Generally the inverted value of the input mask can be used. Mask for lines that should use high range mask for input resolution. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets analog output line to wished voltage level. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Voltage level for AIO0. Voltage level for AIO1. Voltage level for AIO2. Voltage level for AIO3. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets the analog trigger functionality up. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Line to be used as trigger input. Currently the analog trigger is only supported by line AIO3 of the IOcab 8444opto (mask = 0b1000). Voltage level (in millivolts) for the trigger. XL_DAIO_TRIGGER_MODE_ANALOG_ASCENDING, XL_DAIO_TRIGGER_MODE_ANALOG_DESCENDING or XL_DAIO_TRIGGER_MODE_ANALOG (see XLClass.XLdaioTriggerModes). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Configures the digital lines. Per default all lines are set to input. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Mask for lines to be configured as input. Generally the inverted value of the output mask will be used. Mask for lines to be configured as output. A set output line affects always a defined second digital line. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets digital output line to desired logical level. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Switches to be changed (see XL API Description for further details). Mask specifying the switch state for digital output (see XL API Description for further details). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Changes parameters of PWM output to defined frequency and value. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Set PWM frequency to specified value in Hertz.Allowed values: 40…500 Hertz and 2.4kHz…100kHz. Ratio for pulse high pulse low times with resolution of 0.01 percent. Allowed values: 0 (100% pulse low)…10000 (100% pulse high). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets the measurement frequency. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Measurement frequency in ms. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Forces manual measurement of DAIO values. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets up (configure) the FlexRay CC. The function must be called before xlActivate-Channel. It is not possible to change the FlexRay parameters during runtime. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Cluster Configuration to be set. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Returns the actual cluster configuration depending on the channel. See XL API Description for further details.
The port handle retrieved by xlOpenPort (see XL API Description). The access mask specifies the channels for which the function should be execut-ed (see XL API Description: xlOpenPort, xlGetChannelMask). Pointer the XLfrChannelConfig structure. Contains the cluster configuration parameters. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Setup the operational mode for both VN3x00 CCs E-Ray (normal CC) and coldstart (Fujitsu CC). The function must be called before xlActivateChannel and requires init access. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. Structure of different operational modes. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Initializes the coldstart and defines the sync frame. The function must be called before xlActivateChannel and requires “init access”. To select the channel and CC use the flagsChip parameter within the basic event structure. To setup different data for FlexRay channels A and B call it twice. Be sure that the FlexRay config parameters pKeySlotUsedForSync and pKeySlotUsedForSync are set!. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. FlexRay event buffer with the Sync Frame content to be transmitted. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Reads one event from the FlexRay receive queue. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Empty FlexRay event buffer. The received FlexRay event will be available in the buffer. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The function sends static and dynamic frames with the event tag TX or can be used for updates in case of cyclic frames. Additionally frame payload increment can be configured. To configure different payload increment modes for different frChannels, the function has to be called twice (one time for every channel). See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. FlexRay event buffer with the content to be transmitted. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Setup the symbol window. The function must be called before xlActivateChannel and requires “init access”. Defines on which channel the symbol(s) can be sent. At the moment only a MTS (Media Access Test Symbol) symbol is possible. If the function is called the config parameter pChannelMTS value will be overwritten. See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. XL_FR_CHANNEL_A, XL_FR_CHANNEL_B or XL_FR_CHANNEL_AB (see XLClass.XLfrFlagsChipParameters). Mask for the symbol windows which can be sent with xlFrSendSymbolWindow. At the moment only the MTS is supported (Media Access Symbol): XL_FR_SYMBOL_MTS -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
The function setup the transceiver modies. E.g. to set a FlexRay transceiver into sleep, wakeup mode… See XL API Description for further details.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. XL_FR_CHANNEL_A, XL_FR_CHANNEL_B or XL_FR_CHANNEL_AB (see XLClass.XLfrFlagsChipParameters). Specifies the transceiver mode. e.g. XL_TRANSCEIVER_MODE_SLEEP, XL_TRANSCEIVER_MODE_NORMAL (see XLClass.XLfrTransceiverModes). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. XL_FR_SYMBOL_MTS, defines the Media Access Symbol (see XLClass.XLfrSymbolWindows). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
In Asynchronous Mode, all FlexRay frames and symbols are received by the Spy, but no frame transmission is possible at all. If this mode is selected, only the baudrate has to be passed in the pxlClusterConfig parameter of xlFrSetConfiguration, no further FlexRay configuration data is required. The function call is optional. If this function is not called, the FlexRay frame reception is done by E-Ray after the VN3x00 node is integrated in the cluster and the cluster is synchronized.The function may be called after xlSetConfiguration and requires init access.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This handle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Mask specifying which channels shall be used with this port. XL_FR_SYMBOL_MTS, defines the Media Access Symbol (see XLClass.XLfrSpyModes). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Sets up an event to notify the application based on the timerrate which can be set by xlSetTimerRate and xlSetTimerRateAndChannel.
Reference to a variable where the porthandle is returned. This han-dle must be used for any further calls to the port. If -1 is returned, the port was neither created nor opened. Buffer for WIN32 event handle. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: T:vxlapi_NET20.XLClass
member.summary: Rebuilt C structures in class form (not used for direct data exchange!) Note: Data exchange is done with byte arrays instead of structs or classes. Therefor custom marshalling routines are used.

members.member:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Creates and opens a CAN port of the named application/channel number. If the application name is unkown in the Vector Hardware Config, it will be created automatically with two CAN channels.
Name of application in Vector Hardware Config. Channel number of the application to be used (Vector Hardware Config). -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
